text: Mahipala I (913â€“944) was the 9th king of the Gurjara-Pratihara dynasty . He became the king of the dynasty after his step brother Bhoja II. Mahipala I had several other names: Ksitipala, Vinayakapala, Herambapala and Uttarapatha Swami. == Reign == Rashtrakuta emperor Indra III captured Kannauj during Mahipala I's reign. But Mahipala I soon brought Kannauj under control. His court poet Rajasekhara calls him Maharajadhiraja of Aryavarta. According to Kavyamimansa of Rajasekhara,Kavyamimansa of Rajasekhara, ch. XVII, P. 94 Mahipala controlled land from the Beas River in the northwest to Kalinga (present Orissa) in the southeast, and from the Himalayas to the Chera country in the south. During the end of Mahipala I's reign, the kingdom was attacked by the Rashtrakutas. ==References== Category:940s deaths Category:Gurjara- Pratihara Dynasty Category:910s births
title: Mahipala I
